alert.note: Alert for Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 13 at 1:47PM CDT until April 14 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE WESTERN OKLAHOMA AND TEXAS PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron and Texas. In Texas... Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson... Oldham...Potter...Deaf Smith...Randall and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For today`s Red Flag Warning, southwest 15 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. For Friday`s Fire Weather watch, west southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...For today`s Red Flag Warning, as low as 13 percent. For Friday`s Fire Weather Watch, as low as 8 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For today`s Red Flag Warning, 2 to 5. For Friday`s Fire Weather Watch, 2 to 5. * Timing...For today`s Red Flag Warning, through 9 PM CDT. For Friday`s Fire Weather Watch, 12 PM through 9 PM CDT.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
